description: I don’t know who will win the presidential election. Nobody does. But there’s obviously a substantial chance that Donald Trump will return to power. I’m worried for our country and I’m concerned about what my own life would be like under a second Trump term. And you should be, too.

title: How the Death of a Celebrity Squirrel Became a Republican Rallying Cry
description: “I know Don is fired up about P’Nut the squirrel,” JD Vance, the vice-presidential candidate, said at a rally in Sanford, N.C., on Sunday.

title: Tucker Carlson Says Abortions Cause Hurricanes in Election Eve Broadcast
description: Tucker Carlson, a top surrogate for former President Donald J. Trump who spoke at the Republican National Convention this summer and made racist claims at a Trump rally last week at Madison Square Garden, said on Monday that the increased occurrence of hurricanes in the United States was a consequence of abortion — which he characterized as “human sacrifice.”

title: Latest Rallying Cry From Trump’s Allies: ‘Men Must Vote!’
description: In the wee hours of Monday morning, Elon Musk, the billionaire who has put nearly $120 million behind an effort to get Donald J. Trump elected, issued a simple warning on the social media platform he owns. “Men must vote!” he wrote at 2:43 a.m.

title: Man Planned to Use Drone With Explosive to Attack Substation, U.S. Says
description: A 24-year-old Tennessee man was arrested on Saturday moments before he planned to use a drone carrying an explosive to destroy a Nashville power substation to further his “violent white supremacist ideology,” federal prosecutors said Monday.

title: Meta Permits Its A.I. Models to Be Used for U.S. Military Purposes
description: Meta will allow U.S. government agencies and contractors working on national security to use its artificial intelligence models for military purposes, the company said on Monday, in a shift from its policy that prohibited the use of its technology for such efforts.

title: The Candidates Keep Talking About Electric Cars in Michigan. Here’s Why.
description: When former President Donald J. Trump made a September campaign stop in Flint, Mich., he warned that the shift toward electric vehicles could allow China to dominate the automotive industry that built that city and others in Michigan.

title: The Science That Makes Baseball Mud ‘Magical’
description: If you looked closely at the baseballs used in the World Series last month, you would notice that they were covered in a mysterious brown substance.

title: Into the Abyss
description: I spent my weekend driving around southeastern Pennsylvania in a rented minivan. And if the interviews I did there are any indication, there is one thing everyone in this divided nation can agree on: The uncertainty is getting to us.

title: Army Veteran Is Convicted of Assaulting Police Officer at Capitol Riot
description: On Monday, the eve of this year’s presidential election, a New Jersey man was convicted of assaulting a law enforcement officer as part of the mob of Donald J. Trump supporters who stormed the U.S. Capitol on Jan. 6, 2021.

title: ​Despite Trump’s Claim, No Ballots Have Been Found Fraudulent in Lancaster County
description: Details about a continuing investigation revealed by a Republican county commissioner at an election board meeting on Monday undercut claims made by former President Donald J. Trump and others about widespread voter fraud in Lancaster County, Pa.

title: Activists File ‘Bad-Faith’ Ballot Challenges, Pennsylvania Officials Say
description: One by one, they testified under oath: a military spouse who moves every three years. A man just back from six months of traveling around the country. A graduate student temporarily away for school.

title: 10-Minute Challenge: Edward Hopper’s ‘Manhattan Bridge Loop’
description: We’d like you to look at one piece of art for 10 minutes, uninterrupted.

title: Corrections: Nov. 5, 2024
description: An article on Saturday about the first day of Daniel Penny’s trial in the May 2023 killing of Jordan Neely misidentified the county on Long Island where Mr. Penny grew up. It is Suffolk County, not Nassau.

title: Why the U.S. Election Matters in These Countries
description: The world doesn’t pick the U.S. president, but it will face the consequences of whether Americans elect Vice President Kamala Harris or former President Donald J. Trump. New York Times foreign correspondents discuss the top issues in the countries they cover.

title: The Stakes of the Election
description: Presidential campaigns are often scripted spectacles. They can overshadow policy ideas. So editors of The Morning asked reporters at The Times — who dig through tax records, travel to the southern border and study the science of climate change — to explain what Donald Trump’s and Kamala Harris’s positions on several important issues might mean for the country.

title: The Polls Are Close. The Results Might Not Be.
description: These two things are true about the presidential race: The polls currently show Vice President Kamala Harris and former President Donald J. Trump effectively tied. And close polls do not necessarily mean there will be a close result.

title: Speck in the Sea
description: Jump to: Today’s Theme | Tricky Clues

title: What Time Do the Polls Close?
description: This guide offers a state-by-state breakdown, with some tips on what results to watch for at each hour of the night.

title: Joe Rogan Endorses Trump, and Trump Calls Him ‘the Biggest There Is’
description: Joe Rogan, the enormously popular podcast host who brought Donald J. Trump onto his show for a three-hour episode last month, endorsed the former president in a post on social media on Monday.

title: 3 U.S. Intelligence Agencies Warn of Election Interference Efforts by Russia and Iran
description: U.S. intelligence and law enforcement officials are warning that Russia is intensifying its already robust effort to subvert confidence in the presidential election on Tuesday by manufacturing false videos and promoting phony allegations of fraud in swing states to stoke division and sow fear.

title: Arizona Official Releases Voter List Sought by Activists After Court Order
description: Adrian Fontes, Arizona’s secretary of state, said Monday that his office had handed over the names of hundreds of thousands of voters to lawyers for a right-wing activist group as ordered by a court, adding that he regretted having to do so and worried about the potential consequences.

title: What You Need to Know About Election Night Results and The New York Times Needle
description: The 2024 Needle is live. Get the latest presidential election forecast here.

title: Quote of the Day: Fears of Violence and a Sense of Uncertainty
description: “I’ll be so glad when it’s over — I think.”

title: Boeing Union Approves New Contract, Ending Costly Strike
description: Members of Boeing’s largest union approved a new contract on Monday, ending a weekslong strike that was one of the country’s most financially damaging work stoppages in decades.

title: Clues to a Trump or Harris Victory Could Emerge Early. Here’s What to Look For.
description: You might be excited about Election Day, dreading it, or desperate for it to be over.

title: Tiny Homes Face the Ax in Hong Kong, Leaving Many Families Worried
description: As she surveyed her home in Hong Kong, Liu Lanhua tried not to be bothered that her narrow kitchen doubled as the family’s only bathroom.

title: Whether Trump or Harris, Pessimism Reigns in Russia Over U.S. Election Winner
description: The Kremlin may quietly prefer that Donald J. Trump beat Vice President Kamala Harris in the U.S. presidential election on Tuesday. But among hard-liners and ordinary Russians, hopes that either candidate could help bring a swift end to the war in Ukraine — by stopping military aid and effectively forcing Kyiv to accept Russia’s occupation of its territory — are low.

title: Tuesday Briefing
description: The wait is over. Americans will vote today after a presidential campaign season that many say has been darker than any in recent memory. In the final hours, candidates, staff members and tens of thousands of volunteers were in an all-out sprint, with the race deadlocked and the country on edge. Here’s the latest.

title: Fire Destroys Century-Old Building at Knoxville College
description: A fire destroyed a century-old building on the unused campus of a historically Black college in Knoxville, Tennessee, on Monday evening. Images released by the local fire department showed smoke and flames billowing from a gutted structure whose roof was almost entirely gone.

title: These 15 Voters Swung Between Trump and Harris for Months. Here’s What Decided Things.
description: The group discussed Kamala Harris and Donald Trump on the edge of the 2024 election.

title: Vance Mocks Harris as ‘Trash’ in One of His Final Rallies
description: Senator JD Vance of Ohio said in a campaign rally on Monday afternoon that “in two days, we’re going to take out the trash, and the trash’s name is Kamala Harris,” moments after asserting that Ms. Harris had “disrespect” and “even hatred” for some Americans.

title: Word of the Day: indolence
description: The word indolence has appeared in six articles on NYTimes.com in the past year, including on May 23 in “‘The Garfield Movie’ Review: This Feels Like Too Much Effort” by Brandon Yu:

title: Late Night Addresses Your Election Eve Anxiety
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown of the previous night’s highlights that lets you sleep — and lets us get paid to watch comedy. Here are the 50 best movies on Netflix right now.

title: Spelling Bee Forum
description: Hi busy bees! Welcome to today’s Spelling Bee forum. There are a number of terms that appear in both this article and other online discussions of the Spelling Bee; a glossary of those terms compiled by Monicat, a Times reader, can be found below.

title: Standard Time Begins
description: Goodbye, 6 p.m. sunsets. On Sunday, Daylight Saving Time ended and people in many parts of the world, including in the United States, set their clocks back one hour.

title: Who Says You Can’t Live Off the Grid in Manhattan?
description: How long would you go without your refrigerator? How about your stove, lights, coffee maker, microwave, television? In May 2022, Joshua Spodek disconnected his Greenwich Village apartment from the electrical grid to see if he could live unplugged for a year.

title: First U.S. Election Result Is In, and It’s a Trump-Harris Tie
description: The chocolate chip cookies were baked, the room was overheated, and one of America’s weirder election traditions was about to start: All six residents of a former hotel in Dixville Notch, New Hampshire, gathering at midnight to cast their votes for president.

title: When Kentucky Bans Homeless Camps, Where Do People Go?
description: There are many ways to know a city — its front porches, its restaurants, its tourist traps — but Angel Sivado knows Louisville, Ky., by way of its homeless camps.

title: Eliminating Kitchen Clutter Has Never Looked More Stylish
description: One of the joys of undertaking a home renovation is getting to build the kitchen of your dreams. Once that kitchen is in use, though, clutter often finds a way of spoiling the look of prized counters. Some of the biggest offenders tend to be small appliances — coffee makers, toasters, microwaves.

title: A Journey Into 5,000 Years of History at Canyon de Chelly
description: There is an often used, traditional Navajo prayer that begins, “In beauty, I walk.”

title: These Are the Latino Voters Who Could Sway This Election
description: As photographers we often capture the physical act of migration — people in vulnerable situations crossing the U.S. border illegally. But I wanted to understand how movement between countries shapes families in the long term — how children who are first- or second-generation Americans reconfigured their identity.

title: Retailers Jump at the Chance to Invest in Fifth Avenue
description: On the bustling shopping strip of Fifth Avenue in New York City sits something you might not expect to find: an empty lot.

title: What’s the Best Way to Get Rid of Plantar Warts?
description: Q: I get warts on the bottom of my feet. How can I treat and prevent them?

title: From California to the Caribbean: 5 Sunny New Getaways
description: If the thought of winter has you itching to book a sunny escape, here are five new getaways to consider, from California to the Caribbean. Check into a restored Bahamian retreat where Greta Garbo once stayed, or splurge on a luxury villa overlooking the turquoise waters of Turks and Caicos. Soak up the sun on your balcony at a sleek resort north of the hubbub in Cancún, Mexico. Try reiki at a wellness resort on a private island in the Dominican Republic. Or flee to the desert where you can delight in views of the San Jacinto mountains from a rooftop pool in Palm Springs, Calif. Whatever you choose, warm waters and barefoot adventures await.

title: Fifth Avenue: The ‘Street of Dreams’ for Over a Century
description: In 1916, Marjorie Merriweather Post, heir to the Postum  cereal fortune, moved into her new home, a five-story, 54-room mansion at the southeast corner of Fifth Avenue and 92nd Street.

title: Should Single-Use Vapes Be Banned Everywhere?
description: Is vaping a problem at your school or in your community? Do you see discarded vapes littering sidewalks, parks or other public spaces? Do you or your friends vape?

title: Pants That Show You’re in the Know
description: For many people, pants are just something to wear. But for some fashion enthusiasts, pants are a way to flex their taste and show they are in the know.

title: It’s Election Day. Here’s What to Know.
description: Good morning. It’s Tuesday. Today we’ll look at Election Day in New York, from the logistics to the races to watch after the polls close.

title: I’m a Presidential Historian. This Is My Biggest Regret About Trump.
description: I thought I knew what we were dealing with. When Donald Trump began his rise to power in 2015, he struck me as a dangerous but recognizable demagogue. As a biographer of presidents, I tend to think historically and seek analogies from the past to shed light on the present. And so, for years Mr. Trump’s marshaling of fear, prejudice, resentment, xenophobia and extremism put me in mind of grievance-driven figures ranging from Huey Long to Joseph McCarthy to George Wallace. To me, Mr. Trump was a difference not of kind (we had long contended with illiberalism in America) but of degree (since the Civil War, no figure with such illiberal views had ever actually won the White House).

title: Contraband Whiskey and a Secret Royal Dinner: Wall Street Goes to Riyadh
description: At exactly 6:19 p.m. last Tuesday, in a gold-trimmed hallway snaking off the lobby of the Ritz-Carlton, Riyadh, a lesson emerged in money, power and what Arabs call wasta, or influence.

title: Could This Presidential Election Be Decided by the Supreme Court?
description: As the polls open on Election Day, the race between Vice President Kamala Harris and former President Donald J. Trump appears to be a dead heat, leading some to fear that the election will be dragged out and the U.S. Supreme Court could determine the outcome.

title: The Musician Building the Great Native American Songbook
description: The musician Tim Long was sitting at his dining room table on a September morning, looking at old family photos and talking about how good can sometimes emerge from suffering.

title: Advice From a Psychotherapist on How to Cope Today
description: If there’s anything that keeps me and my psychotherapist colleagues in business, it’s uncertainty. You can dance on the horns of a dilemma for only so long before obsession, anxiety, depression — the staples of mental unease — set in.

title: Where Dinner Starts With a Show
description: The showmanship that can involve pizza is on full display at the first New York outpost of the international chain, now comprising 15 locations, that started in Italy. It occupies the former Osteria Morini space with Altamarea Group, the owner of that restaurant, as a partner with Majestas, the founder. As at the other locations, chefs enter the dining room spinning the dough to the sounds of another spinner, a D.J. stationed at the bar. A broad Italian menu offers typical appetizers and pastas plus 23 pizzas, including focaccia con stracchino, a take on the famous focaccia col formaggio of Recco, Italy. (Wednesday)

title: Israeli or Palestinian, U.S. Voters in the West Bank Say Biden Let Them Down
description: Like many Israelis, Bronx-born Eli Knoller, who has dual citizenship and lives in an Israeli settlement in the West Bank, hopes the next American president allows Israel to “finish the job” against Hamas in Gaza, where his son was killed in battle.

title: Have Election Anxiety? These Five Minutes Can Help.
description: Today, many of us are ruminating on an unknowable future. Eliza Barclay, a climate editor for New York Times Opinion and a certified mindfulness instructor, is here to help with that. In this five-minute mindfulness meditation, she aims to help listeners ease their fears and anxieties about the election by drawing their attention to the present moment.

title: To Help His TV Show, He Became a Meme
description: The start of a new TV show is a fraught time for its creators and stars. Years of work have gone into its debut, yet the window of time in which to attract viewers is brief. Add a splintered media environment and an oxygen-sucking presidential election, and the chances for cultural relevancy slip further.

title: A Final Dispatch From America’s Bellwether
description: For months now, “The Run-Up” has been traveling around the country talking with people, trying to ensure that when today came, whatever happened wouldn’t feel like a surprise.

title: The Anti-Anxiety Election Day Menu
description: It took forever, but today is finally here. As the election results start to pour in, you may not be able to ever totally turn off your anxieties. Maybe you could try feeding them instead with these simple recipes.

title: The Best Laid Plans to Enjoy (or Ignore) Election Day
description: Madeline Walker, 27, was talking to a close friend about how chaotic Election Day can be, especially in Atlanta, where they both live.

title: How the Election Could Unfold: Four Scenarios
description: The 2024 election is close and deeply uncertain.

title: Don’t Let Trump Make America Into an Image of Himself
description: There have been several American Republics.

title: What We’ll Know and When We’ll Know It: A Guide to Election Night
description: Four years ago, it took days for news organizations to project Joe Biden as the winner of the election.

title: Election Day Is Long. Give Us Five Minutes to Get You Through It.
description: Sick of doomscrolling? Try this guided meditation instead.

title: For ‘Dinner in America,’ a Surprise Theatrical Run Is Dessert
description: On a recent weeknight at the IFC Center in Manhattan’s West Village, staff members corralled a 400-person crowd in and out of the doors while swarms circled the lead actors of the sold-out feature playing that night: “Dinner in America.” The film — an angsty rom-com that debuted at the Sundance Film Festival in 2020 but struggled to find distribution before being self-released in 2022 — has catapulted from crickets to cult status since going viral on TikTok in the past couple of months. Seizing on a rare encore, the filmmakers have rallied fans to support a shot at the theatrical run they never had.

title: I Voted for Harris, but Gaza’s Horrors Weigh on My Conscience
description: I voted for Kamala Harris, even though I think that places me on the wrong side of history.

title: How to Follow The Times’s Election Results and Coverage
description: Election Day is here. Vice President Kamala Harris and former President Donald J. Trump have been deadlocked in the polls, teeing up what is likely to be a nail-biter of a race to keep tabs on once the polls start closing.

title: ‘I Will Be Thrilled to Be Wrong’: Four Columnists Brace for Election Night
description: Patrick Healy, the deputy Opinion editor, hosted an online conversation with the Times Opinion columnists David Brooks, Ross Douthat, Michelle Goldberg and Tressie McMillan Cottom about election night and what will follow.

title: Born in London, Raised in Nigeria, She’s Now Leading Britain’s Conservatives
description: Britain’s Conservative Party made history last weekend, becoming the country’s first major party to elect a Black woman as leader.

title: ‘The Curious Case of Benjamin Button’ Gets a Folk-Musical Makeover
description: Benjamin Button is born onto the West End stage with a hunch, a walking stick and venerable observations more suitable to a wizened man than a newborn.

title: Wordle Review No. 1,236
description: Welcome to The Wordle Review. Be warned: This page contains spoilers for today’s puzzle. Solve Wordle first, or scroll at your own risk.

title: At Din Tai Fung, the Hunt for Delicate Dumplings Is Hit or Miss
description: There was much excitement in the New York dumpling community when Din Tai Fung announced it would open an outpost in Manhattan — the Taiwanese restaurant chain’s 182nd opening worldwide and its 16th location in the United States, but the first one east of Las Vegas. In July, thousands of hopefuls kept vigil at their laptops to score reservations as they were released, only to watch them vanish in minutes.

title: The Connections Companion No. 514
description: Good morning, dear connectors. Welcome to today’s Connections forum, where you can give and receive puzzle — and emotional — support.

title: Election Day Decisions, and Why the Count Could Take Awhile
description: On Today’s Episode:

title: A Guide to Election Night 2024
description: After two years of campaigning, more than a billion of dollars of advertising and a last-minute change to one of the nominees, the 2024 race for president is now in the hands of the American voters.

title: How Markets Could Respond to the Election
description: Investors on Wall Street have a playbook for trading the markets around Election Day.

title: Cryptocurrency Markets, Promoted by Trump, Brace for Election Volatility
description: For months, cryptocurrency investors have been eagerly awaiting the presidential election, convinced that a victory for former President Donald J. Trump would be good for Bitcoin.

title: Truth Social May Be the Company With the Most at Stake This Election
description: The stock price of former President Donald J. Trump’s social media company has swung up and down over the past few weeks, but it may be in for an even wilder ride.

title: It’s Election Day
description: Today is the rare day that’s likely to change the trajectory of the United States.

title: What to Expect on Election Day
description: It’s Election Day. A third of voters have already cast their ballots in one of the most unconventional, expensive and tightest presidential campaigns in history.

title: Weekly Student News Quiz: Election Day, World Series, Floods
description: Have you been paying attention to current events recently? See how many of these 10 questions you can get right.

title: These 8 Counties Could Hint at Where the Election Is Headed
description: When the polls close on Tuesday, we will be watching, of course, for statewide outcomes in the presidential battlegrounds. But as we wait for calls, there will be individual counties you can look to for clues — though not definitive ones — to the contours of the vote.

title: Japanese Scientists Bet on an Ancient Material for Their New Satellite: Wood
description: Since Sputnik 1 was launched in 1957, satellites have been made with metals. A group of Japanese scientists thinks it has a viable alternative: wood.

title: Israeli Strikes Target Syria for a Second Day in a Row
description: The Israeli military on Tuesday said its Air Force had struck targets in Syria for the second day in a row, attacks it said were aimed at cutting off the flow of weapons and intelligence between Hezbollah, the armed Lebanese group, and its sponsor, Iran.

title: Gazans Fear Neither Candidate in U.S. Election Will Help Them
description: The Biden administration’s support for Israel in the war in Gaza has been divisive for left-leaning voters in the United States, including many Arab Americans, and some say it has soured them on Vice President Kamala Harris’s candidacy.

title: Here’s When Polls Open Across the United States
description: Americans headed to the polls on Tuesday to cast their ballots in an extraordinarily close presidential election.

title: How Lina Khan Became an Election Hot Topic
description: In the run-up to the election, Lina Khan, chair of the Federal Trade Commission, was called a dope, partisan and unhelpful by Democrats and Republicans. Democratic donors including the billionaires Reid Hoffman, Barry Diller and Mark Cuban called for her ouster from the agency. Last week, a report from the Republican-led House Judiciary Committee accused her of having a far-left agenda and weaponizing the agency.

title: For Biden Officials, Lebanon May Be a Problem Too Big to Solve
description: With faint hopes for ending the war in Gaza before President Biden leaves office, U.S. officials have turned their focus to Lebanon, where they are scrambling to strike a cease-fire deal to end Israel’s invasion of the country.

title: Politics, Power and Campus Culture
description: To the Editor:

title: Britain’s Queen Camilla Cancels Royal Engagements Because of Illness
description: Queen Camilla, the wife of Britain’s King Charles III, has withdrawn from two scheduled engagements this week after contracting a chest infection, Buckingham Palace said on Tuesday.

title: Can Donald Trump Still Vote as a Convicted Felon? Here’s What to Know.
description: Donald J. Trump’s home state of Florida has historically made it difficult for those convicted of felonies to vote, but Mr. Trump will face no such hurdles casting a ballot for himself this Election Day.

title: Elon Musk Pushes ‘Ballot Curing’ in Pennsylvania, Eyeing Tight Margin
description: Elon Musk’s super PAC has been emphasizing “ballot curing” in the final days of the presidential campaign, a highly expensive strategy meant to pick up a few additional votes in a razor-thin election.

title: Quincy Jones, the Maestro of the Recording Studio
description: “Quincy called me.”

title: Search for the Missing in Spain Grows Desperate Amid Mud and Confusion
description: Some families in Spain were planning funerals on Tuesday, days after their relatives’ bodies were found in the aftermath of floods that killed at least 217 people. Others were still waiting for news, caught between grief and the hope that a missing relative could still be alive somewhere in the muck.

title: North Carolina Breaks Democrats’ Hearts
description: This article has been updated to reflect new developments.

title: The Hyper-Close House Race That Could Make All the Difference
description: On the final Friday before Election Day, in what may be the tightest House race in the country, Josh Riley, the Democratic candidate for New York’s 19th Congressional District, was making the case to me that this contest would turn not on voters’ partisan leanings but on which candidate people believe shares their “upstate values.” Not that he was terribly illuminating about what those are.

title: Four Weeknight Dishes and Baked Alfredo Pasta
description: It’s Election Day here in the United States, and I’ve been asking everyone I see what they’ll be doing tonight as the results start to roll in.

title: A Hollywood Drought and a Game Show Dream
description: There is very little work to go around in Hollywood these days. So to stay inspired over the past several months, Emily Winter has met with a writing group on Zoom each weekday morning at 10 a.m.

title: Harris’s Plans for Black Men Aim to Avoid the Setbacks Biden Faced
description: In the final stretch of the presidential campaign, Vice President Kamala Harris has been promoting her “Opportunity Agenda for Black Men” to help boost turnout among a vital constituency whose support for her has been slipping.

title: Irish Leader Plans to Call Election Later This Week
description: Simon Harris, the prime minister of Ireland, on Tuesday announced plans to call a general election by the end of the week, ending months of speculation over its timing.

title: More Than 80 Million Americans Cast Early Ballots
description: More than 80 million voters cast an early ballot either by mail or in person in a weekslong early voting season that was defined by a relatively seamless process.

title: Bernie Marcus, Home Depot Co-Founder, Is Dead at 95
description: Bernie Marcus, who came up with a revolutionary business idea in the late 1970s — create a do-it-yourself, big-box suburban outlet that would seem more warehouse than store — and, with a partner, turned it into the Home Depot, the world’s largest home-improvement retailer, died on Monday in Boca Raton, Fla. He was 95.

title: U.S. Expects Foreign Adversaries to Stoke Anger Over Election Results
description: Russia continued to push out disinformation to undermine faith in the U.S. election on Tuesday, but American officials said they were bracing for an even bigger assault of false narratives in the days and weeks after the vote.

title: Here are the governor’s races to watch.
description: Voters are poised to elect governors on Tuesday in 11 states, including eight that are wide open, with no incumbent running. But only a handful of races are expected to be competitive. Indeed, neither party is expected to gain an edge from the current configuration of eight Republicans and three Democrats in those states — except in maybe one state.

title: Britain Confirms Two Cases of Newer Type of Mpox
description: Two new cases of the version of mpox that has fueled a deadly outbreak in central Africa have been detected in Britain, according to the country’s health authorities. But the authorities say that the overall risk of a rapid spread in the country remains low.

title: Where Can You Register to Vote on Election Day?
description: Nearly half of U.S. states and Washington, D.C., allow voters to register and cast ballots on Election Day. Vote.gov provides state-specific instructions on how and where to register and what kind of identification is needed. Voters can also check their registration status there.

title: Flo Wants to Reinvent the Girl Group for a New Generation
description: Flo’s singles kept on coming, but where was a full-fledged album? When all its pop machinery was already in motion, the group dared to put its debut on pause.

title: China Confronts Europe Over Climate-Based Trade Restrictions
description: Before they even started, next week’s talks over the world’s collective response to climate change got even more complicated with an 11th-hour move by China on Tuesday.

title: Israel Presses On With Military Operations in Gaza and West Bank
description: Israel’s military continued to target armed fighters in the northern part of the West Bank even as it conducts major operations in Gaza and Lebanon.

title: Trump, Vance and Allies Hurl Insults at Women as Race Ends
description: Standing at his final rally of the 2024 campaign, former President Donald J. Trump in the first minutes after midnight on Election Day used a crude sexist remark to attack Representative Nancy Pelosi, the former House speaker who is one of his longstanding political rivals.

title: Russia Plotted to Put Incendiary Devices on Cargo Planes, Officials Say
description: Russia has been plotting to place incendiary devices on cargo planes in Europe and even performed a test run this summer, setting off fires at shipping hubs in Britain and Germany, according to four Western officials briefed on intelligence about the operation.

title: Growing Food Instead of Lawns in California Front Yards
description: On a corner lot in Leimert Park in dusty South Los Angeles, not far from Obama and Crenshaw Boulevards, sits a curiosity that’s wildly different from all the neighboring grassy yards. Abundant and lush, it looks like a mash-up between a country idyll and something dreamed up by Dr. Seuss.

title: Israel’s Netanyahu Fires Defense Minister, Citing ‘Gaps’ in Approach to War
description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu fired his defense minister, Yoav Gallant, on Tuesday over differences on the prosecution of the war in Gaza — a risky step at a moment when Israel is fighting on two fronts. The move sparked protests across the country, including a large gathering near the prime minister’s residence in Jerusalem.

title: Musk to Spend Election Night With Trump
description: Elon Musk plans to spend election night with former President Donald J. Trump, giving Mr. Trump direct access to the person controlling one of key information platforms on what could be a chaotic evening.

title: Trump Votes and Says This Will Be His Last Campaign
description: Former President Donald J. Trump cast his ballot for himself in Palm Beach, Fla., on Tuesday and said this was likely to be his last campaign, no matter the outcome.

title: What to Know About the 10 Ballot Measures in California
description: California is known for its love of direct democracy, and voters in the nation’s most populous state are once again wading through a mix of ballot proposals that could confuse even the most sophisticated of voters.

title: What Are Your Reactions to the Results of Election 2024?
description: Please keep in mind that this forum is for teenagers only. While there are many places on NYTimes.com for adults to comment, this is the only dedicated spot for the voices of young people.

title: ‘Moo Deng? Who Deng?’ Meet Haggis the Baby Pygmy Hippo.
description: Haggis is a Scottish pudding prepared by cooking sheep organs inside the animal’s stomach, in which it is also served.

title: A Climate-Focused Guide to Election Day
description: It’s Election Day in the United States, and the outcome of the presidential race will have a huge impact on the world’s efforts to deal with climate change.

title: 9 Great Songs That Mention Baseball Stars
description: I’m back! A big thank you to Jon Caramanica, Marc Tracy and Dave Renard, the three guest playlisters who filled in for me while I took a few weeks off. The Amplifier returns to its regular schedule today, though, just in time for … I don’t know, anything important going on this week?

title: Influencer Flanked by E-Bike Riders at N.Y.C. Marathon Is Banned, Organizers Say
description: A running influencer with nearly half a million followers who ran the New York City Marathon on Sunday while flanked by two electric bikes has been banned for life from the marathon and other events held by the organizers.

title: Election Night at The Times, Through the Decades
description: The presidential election is one of the most important nights of the year for the United States. The same can be said for The New York Times.

title: Giuliani Moved Possessions From N.Y. Apartment as Creditors Closed In
description: On the morning of Halloween last week, lawyers for two former Georgia election workers walked into Rudolph W. Giuliani’s Upper East Side apartment. They were there to get an estimate on what it would cost to move the former mayor’s belongings. Not much, it turned out.

title: Bomb Threats Hit Several States, but None Are Found Credible
description: Polling places in several states were targeted by bomb threats on Tuesday, officials said, leading to evacuations and some disruptions in voting, although none of the threats were immediately found to be credible.

title: Facing Outrage, Nigeria Drops Capital Charges Against Minors
description: Dozens of teenagers, some as young as 14, had been held for nearly three months in a squalid detention center that houses murder suspects. They faced treason charges and possible death sentences for alleged participation in protests against Nigeria’s government.

title: Lightning Strikes Soccer Team in Peru, Killing Player
description: A soccer player in Peru died after he was struck by lightning this week, according to local news reports, an incident captured on video in an arresting reminder of the dangers of being outdoors in a storm with lightning.

title: ‘Love Is Blind’ Resets, ‘Survivor’ Stalls: A Reality TV Check-in
description: Long-running reality-television franchises — with their familiar rhythms, tensions and resolutions — can provide a wonderful way to pass the time while, say, waiting for votes to be counted.

title: How to Hand-Wash All Your Clothes
description: If laundry is a chore, hand washing might feel like punishment. Who has the time, let alone the space, to soak and lay out to dry large, delicate garments? Running to the dry cleaner can seem like the best option. But the fabric-conscious experts below argue that hand washing the clothes you love is almost always better: It’s easier on fabrics, helping garments last longer, and it can be surprisingly low fuss. Here’s how they do it.

title: Nebraska U.S. Senate Election Results
description: Get live results and maps from the 2024 Nebraska general election.

title: Boeing’s Strike Is Over. Its Problems Are Not.
description: After nearly two months on strike, some 33,000 Boeing employees will return to work over the next week. But getting the troubled manufacturer back on track will take a lot longer.

title: Idaho Election Results
description: Get live results and maps from the 2024 Idaho elections.

title: Kansas Election Results
description: Get live results and maps from the 2024 Kansas elections.

title: New Mexico Election Results
description: Get live results and maps from the 2024 New Mexico elections.

title: West Virginia Election Results
description: Get live results and maps from the 2024 West Virginia elections.

title: State Ballot Measures to Watch: Abortion, Elections, Minimum Wage
description: Voters in 41 states on Tuesday are considering a daunting list of ballot measures. They include guarantees of abortion rights, changes in election rules, increases in minimum wages, marijuana legalization and public funding for private schools.

title: How We Model Election Results With the Needle
description: Our live election night forecast is known as “the Needle.” Nate Cohn, chief political analyst for The New York Times, explains how it works.

title: What Democracy Looks Like in Rural Wisconsin: One Woman Counting Her Neighbors’ Votes
description: Graceann Toberman climbed out of bed at 3:50 a.m. on Tuesday, when the sky over her 120-acre farm in southern Wisconsin was inky black, the animals outside were sleeping and the only sound was the flapping of the American flag in the wind. Her to-do list was beckoning.

title: How Should History Books Remember the 2024 Election?
description: The voting is almost over, and now the United States presidential election of 2024 is about to enter an uncertain new phase. This will be the last week to respond to the surveys we’ve posted in the Headway Election Challenge, but now that the nation is beginning to look ahead to Inauguration Day, we’d like to invite participants in the challenge to help us with one last project.

title: Special Edition: America Votes
description: After a grueling and polarizing campaign, American voters are choosing their next president. It’s hours before the last polls close in Alaska, and it may be days until one of the closest presidential elections in U.S. history is decided.

title: How Many Swing State Voters Are Turning Out for Election Day?
description: In an election that could come down to a photo finish, the answer to a crucial question will determine the next president: How many Americans would vote on Election Day?

title: When Quincy Jones Worked With Michael Jackson, ‘We Had No Limitations’
description: Quincy Jones first met Michael Jackson in the early 1970s at Sammy Davis Jr.’s house in Los Angeles, when the 12-year-old was still a bubble-gum soul singer leading his brothers in the Jackson 5.

title: Despite Bomb Threats and Disinformation, a Fairly Smooth Election
description: Americans navigated a fraught voting landscape on Election Day as a largely smooth voting process early in the day went on to be buffeted by bomb threats, widespread disinformation and unabated anxiety over the election system.

title: An Idaho Health Department Is Barred From Offering Covid Shots
description: An Idaho health department is no longer offering Covid-19 shots after its board voted last month to restrict the department from doing so, an unusual step driven largely by misinformation about the side effects and safety of the shots.

title: What Elon Musk Told His 203 Million X Followers on Election Day
description: On Election Day, Elon Musk used his X account to encourage his 203 million followers to vote for Donald J. Trump. He also used it to stoke fears about election interference.

title: ‘Butchered’ Dolphin Found on Jersey Shore Is Subject of Federal Inquiry
description: Federal wildlife authorities have opened an investigation into a grisly discovery on a Jersey Shore beach: the partial remains of a dolphin that, according to a marine animal rescue group, “appeared to have been butchered.”

title: Trump Says This Will Be His Last Campaign
description: The former president cast his ballot in Florida, and said that if he loses the election and it’s a fair election, he’d “be the first one to acknowledge it.”

title: Los Angeles Faces a ‘Particularly Dangerous Situation’ for Wildfire Weather
description: An intense Santa Ana wind event, California’s second this week, is expected to bring “extremely critical” fire weather and put much of Los Angeles and Ventura Counties in a “particularly dangerous situation” for risky wildfire weather from late Tuesday through Friday, forecasters said.

title: Who Is Israel Katz, Israel’s New Defense Minister?
description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel named Israel Katz as the country’s new defense minister after firing Yoav Gallant on Tuesday over policy differences amid wars in Gaza and Lebanon.

title: A Polarized Nation Votes
description: Tens of millions of Americans went to the polls today to elect the next president. Some voters, particularly in the West, have a few more hours to cast their ballots. But soon, the dizzying and contentious race between Donald Trump and Kamala Harris will become an exercise in patience as votes are being counted.

title: A History of Clashes Between Netanyahu and the Defense Minister He Fired
description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel on Tuesday dismissed his defense minister, Yoav Gallant, as the country fights a two-front war and waits for the results of a pivotal U.S. presidential election.

title: The Election Eve Library Party With Spike Lee and Martha Stewart
description: On the eve of Election Day, crowds of writers, artists and politicians stepped past the stone lions outside the New York Public Library’s regal main branch on Fifth Avenue in Manhattan to attend the Library Lions gala, an autumn tradition that raises funds for the city’s largest library system.

title: Who Is Chase Oliver, the Libertarian Candidate for President?
description: If you search Google for “election results,” as millions of people are doing on Tuesday evening, four names come up in a chart at the top of the page. Kamala Harris and Donald J. Trump, of course. Jill Stein, the Green Party candidate who is fairly well known for her 2016 run. And Chase Oliver — or, as many Americans are likely to say, who?

title: Your Guide to Our Election Coverage
description: It’s here. It’s time. The first battleground state polls are going to close in an hour.

title: An ‘Old Reliable Friend’: Readers Share Their JanSport Memories
description: Murray McCory revolutionized school life with a lightweight backpack that he created through JanSport, the outdoors equipment company he founded in 1967. By the mid-1980s, JanSport bags were ubiquitous in colleges and high schools.

title: Judge Denies Request to Extend Hours Despite 6-Hour Wait to Vote Near Lehigh University
description: Young people were turning out in droves at a polling site near Lehigh University in Bethlehem, Pa, on Tuesday afternoon, with students waiting for several hours, in lines extending for blocks, to cast their votes.

title: North Korea Enters Ukraine Fight for First Time, Officials Say
description: North Korean troops have entered the fight in Russia’s war against Ukraine, clashing for the first time with Ukrainian forces who are occupying a large chunk of Russia’s Kursk region, according to a senior Ukrainian official and a senior U.S. official.

title: California Might Have to Wait Weeks for House Battleground Results
description: California likes to think of itself as a fast-moving state, but its pace can be downright plodding when it comes to counting votes.

title: Voters Wait in Line for Hours to Cast Ballot in Pennsylvania
description: Young people stood in line at a polling site near Lehigh University in Bethlehem, Pa., for several hours on Tuesday.

title: To Whom It May Concern
description: Dear President-elect ­­­­­__________,

title: You May Not Be Able to Outrun a Vampire Bat
description: With gargoyle-like faces, razor-sharp fangs and an insatiable thirst for blood, vampire bats are nightmare fuel. And that’s before they start running.

title: What to Know About Yoav Gallant
description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel fired Yoav Gallant, his powerful and popular defense minister, on Tuesday, after the two clashed over the course of Israel’s war against Hamas in the Gaza Strip.

title: Justice Wins Election in West Virginia, Giving Republicans a Senate Edge
description: Jim Justice, the popular Republican governor of West Virginia, has easily won election to the Senate, according to The Associated Press, in a widely predicted victory that helped shift control of the chamber closer to the G.O.P.

title: Mexico’s Top Court Dismisses Proposal to Invalidate Contentious Judicial Overhaul
description: Mexico’s Supreme Court on Tuesday dismissed a proposal that would have struck down core parts of a recent overhaul of the country’s courts system, effectively ending any contest against a redesign of the judiciary in which nearly all judges must now be elected instead of appointed.

title: Tyka Nelson, Sister of Prince Who Carved Her Own Path, Dies at 64
description: Tyka Nelson, who was once called “the most famous unknown singer” as she followed her brother, Prince, into a four-album recording career, and who helped promote his legacy after his death in 2016, died on Monday in Robbinsdale, Minn. She was 64.

title: Black Voters Weigh Character, Policies and Politics at the Polls
description: Rudy Cash, a 19-year-old food server, voted in a presidential election for the first time on Tuesday.

title: Andy Kim Wins in New Jersey to Become the First Korean American Senator
description: Representative Andy Kim was elected on Tuesday to the U.S. Senate by a decisive margin, according to The Associated Press, after a tumultuous campaign that grew out of a corruption scandal that engulfed New Jersey’s former senator, Robert Menendez, a once-powerful Democrat.

title: Live Presidential Forecast
description: Follow real-time estimates from The New York Times of the outcome in the race between Kamala Harris and Donald J. Trump.

title: Trump Is the First Republican Presidential Candidate to Win Miami-Dade County Since 1988
description: Former President Donald J. Trump won Miami-Dade County, Fla., on Tuesday, unofficial election results show, solidifying the remarkable blue-to-red swing of the state’s most populous county.

title: Contractor Who Defrauded Navy of Millions and Fled Gets 15 Years in Prison
description: A Malaysian ship-supply contractor who bribed U.S. Navy officials to secure tens of millions of dollars in military contracts and fled the country after pleading guilty was sentenced on Tuesday to 15 years in prison, federal prosecutors said.

title: Trump Team Revokes Election Party Access for Some Journalists
description: Former President Donald J. Trump’s campaign has blocked multiple reporters from its election watch event on Tuesday night at his Mar-a-Lago club in Florida.

title: Josh Stein Defeats Mark Robinson in North Carolina Governor’s Race
description: Josh Stein, North Carolina’s Democratic attorney general, won the governor’s race in the state, according to The Associated Press. He defeated Lt. Gov. Mark Robinson, a Republican who had been widely criticized for his extensive record of incendiary remarks.

title: Why Exit Polls Are Misleading
description: As you wait for votes to be counted and results to trickle in, you might be curious about whether the exit polls you sometimes see cited on TV or social media can provide a preview of what’s to come.

title: From Coast to Coast, Americans Cast Their Ballots
description: On Tuesday, tens of millions of voters showed up at town halls, churches and high school gymnasiums across the country to cast their ballots.

title: Flooding in Missouri Kills at Least 5, Including 2 Poll Workers
description: At least five people, including two poll workers, died in floods across Missouri this week, prompting Gov. Mike Parson to activate an emergency operations plan.

title: Abortion Rights Measure Fails in Florida
description: A ballot measure that would have enshrined abortion rights in the Florida Constitution failed, according to The Associated Press, delivering a major defeat to proponents who had hoped to restore broad access to the procedure in the nation’s third-largest state.

title: Republicans Clinch Control of the Senate
description: Republicans seized control of the Senate in Tuesday’s voting, picking up at least three Democratic seats and protecting their own embattled lawmakers to end four years of Democratic control.

title: New Yorkers Pass an Equal Rights Amendment Tied to Abortion Access
description: A ballot measure in New York designed to safeguard protections for abortion and for those most vulnerable to discrimination passed overwhelmingly on Tuesday, according to The Associated Press.

title: Site for Crafts
description: Jump to: Today’s Theme | Tricky Clues

title: Alsobrooks Defeats Hogan in Maryland, Keeping a Blue-State Senate Seat
description: Angela Alsobrooks, the Democratic Prince George’s County executive, has easily defeated former Gov. Larry Hogan to become Maryland’s first Black senator, according to The Associated Press.

title: Gov. Greg Gianforte of Montana Handily Wins Re-election
description: Greg Gianforte won re-election as Montana’s governor on Tuesday, according to The Associated Press, helping Republicans solidify their power in a state that in recent years has taken a sharp turn to the right.

title: Protests Erupt in Tel Aviv After Netanyahu Fires Gallant
description: Crowds lit bonfires and blocked traffic on a major highway after the Israeli prime minister sacked the defense minister, citing “gaps” between their views on handling the war in Gaza.

title: Delaware Lawmaker Wins House Seat, Becoming First Openly Transgender Member of Congress
description: Sarah McBride, a Delaware state legislator, won a race for the House of Representatives, The Associated Press reported, making her the first openly transgender person elected to Congress.

title: Pat Ryan Holds a Democratic House Swing Seat in New York
description: Representative Pat Ryan, Democrat of New York, won a second full term on Tuesday, according to The Associated Press, holding a key swing district in his party’s quest to flip the House majority.

title: Kelly Ayotte, a Republican, Is Elected Governor of New Hampshire
description: Kelly Ayotte, a Republican and former United States senator, was elected governor of New Hampshire, The Associated Press reported.

title: Deadly Floodwaters Inundate Missouri
description: Intense storms brought tornadoes and flash floods that killed two poll workers when their vehicle was swept off a road.

title: Bitcoin Surges to Record as Crypto Investors Cheer Trump Win
description: Donald Trump has won the 2024 presidential election. Follow live updates and results.

title: Stocks Set Records and Dollar Soars After Trump Election Win
description: Stocks surged to record highs, the dollar strengthened around the world, and government bond yields soared on Wednesday after a conclusive win by President-elect Donald J. Trump.

title: Pennsylvania Becomes Hot Spot for Election Disinformation
description: Pennsylvania quickly emerged on Tuesday as a hot spot for election disinformation and bogus claims of voter fraud. The vast majority of posts on X about election fraud were focused on the swing state, according to an analysis by PeakMetrics, an analytics company.

title: Schiff Wins Senate Race to Fill the Feinstein Seat in California
description: Representative Adam Schiff, who led the prosecution of Donald J. Trump’s first impeachment, won California’s open Senate seat, according to The Associated Press, beating his Republican opponent, Steve Garvey, a former professional baseball star and a first-time candidate.

title: Japan’s Favorite Snowy Mountain Finally Has Some Snow
description: Mount Fuji looms large as Japan’s tallest mountain and one of its most enduring national symbols. Its snowy peak has inspired countless paintings and poems over the centuries, and more recently been featured on travel brochures and merchandise.

title: Trump Wins North Carolina, a Critical Battleground State for Republicans
description: Former President Donald J. Trump won North Carolina, according to The Associated Press, retaining his grip on a fast-growing Southern battleground state that his campaign viewed as a must-win.

title: With Mannion Win, N.Y. Democrats Flip First House Seat in the Country
description: State Senator John Mannion has defeated Representative Brandon Williams of New York, according to The Associated Press, delivering Democrats the first flipped House seat in the country.

title: Missouri Voters Pass Measure to Protect Abortion Rights and End Ban
description: Missouri voters approved a ballot amendment that enshrines a right to abortion in the State Constitution, The Associated Press reported, a stunning repudiation of one of the nation’s strictest bans on abortion.

title: Moreno Defeats Brown in Ohio, Putting G.O.P. Within Reach of Senate Control
description: Bernie Moreno, a wealthy former car dealer and hard-right Republican, has defeated three-term Democratic Senator Sherrod Brown of Ohio, according to The Associated Press, giving the G.O.P. enough seats to win the Senate majority unless Democrats pulled out an unexpected win in another competitive race.

title: Ted Cruz Survives Another Re-Election Fight in Texas
description: Senator Ted Cruz of Texas fended off an aggressive and well-funded Democratic challenger to win a third term and preserve decades of Republican Party dominance in the nation’s most populous red state, according to The Associated Press.

title: Quote of the Day: He Rebuilt It, and They Came. ‘This Time Willingly.’
description: “Just thinking about what it was like back in the ’40s when they were stuck here. To me, baseball has always been about connection.”

title: LaLota Fends Off Democratic Challenge to Win Key New York House Seat
description: Representative Nick LaLota, Republican of New York, secured a second term on Tuesday, according to The Associated Press, turning back a spirited challenge by John Avlon, a former CNN commentator.

title: 5 Dead in Arizona After Small Plane Crashes Into Vehicle
description: Five people were killed after a small passenger plane failed to take off and crashed into a vehicle near the airport in Mesa, Ariz., on Tuesday, the police said.

title: Republicans Beat Back Democratic Challenge to Hold New Jersey House Seat
description: Representative Thomas Kean Jr., a first-term Republican, was re-elected on Tuesday after a hard-fought race in New Jersey against a Democratic challenger, Sue Altman, according to The Associated Press.

title: Democrats Flip Newly Drawn Alabama Congressional Seat
description: Shomari Figures, a Democrat and former Justice Department official, won election in Alabama’s newly drawn Second Congressional District, according to The Associated Press, handing his party a rare pickup in the South.

title: Omaha, Nebraska’s So-Called Blue Dot, Goes for Harris
description: Voters delivered the one electoral vote up for grabs in Nebraska to Vice President Kamala Harris, according to The Associated Press, a Democratic victory in a hotly contested region.

title: Fischer Wins in Nebraska, Giving Republicans Enough Seats for a Majority
description: Senator Deb Fischer, Republican of Nebraska, has won a third term, according to The Associated Press, staving off a spirited and unexpectedly tough challenge from independent Dan Osborn, an industrial mechanic and political newcomer, and giving her party enough seats to take the majority.

title: Trump Wins Georgia, Re-establishing Republicans’ Dominance There
description: Former President Donald J. Trump won Georgia’s 16 electoral votes, according to a New York Times projection, flipping the swing state back to Republicans after Joseph R. Biden Jr.’s landmark victory there in 2020.

title: Nebraska Voters Pass Measure Limiting Abortions
description: A ballot amendment prohibiting abortion beyond the first three months of pregnancy passed in Nebraska, according to The Associated Press, outpolling a competing measure that would have established a right to abortion until fetal viability.

title: Jon Stewart Tries to Find Good News on Election Night
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown of the previous night’s highlights that lets you sleep — and lets us get paid to watch comedy. Here are the 50 best movies on Netflix right now.

title: Democrats Flip a Second House Seat in New York, Toppling Molinaro
description: Democrat Josh Riley has defeated the Republican incumbent, Representative Marc Molinaro, according to The Associated Press, flipping New York’s 19th Congressional District in one of the most watched House races of the cycle.

title: Wednesday Briefing
description: As of early this morning, with votes still being counted, Donald Trump was ahead in the race to be the next president of the United States. His fellow Republicans won control of the Senate. Here’s the latest.

title: Word of the Day: epitomize
description: The word epitomize has appeared in nine articles on NYTimes.com in the past year, including on Aug. 17 in “Sausage Legs and Wax Nose Jobs: Peeling the Layers on a Century of Beauty” by Sadie Stein:

title: Anticipating a Close Race, the Nation Watched Momentum Shift Toward Trump
description: The first signs came in the suburbs.

title: Trump Wins Pennsylvania, a Key Swing State Prize
description: Former President Donald J. Trump has won Pennsylvania and its 19 electoral votes, according to The Associated Press, flipping the crucial swing state back to his column after President Biden’s victory there in 2020.

title: Spelling Bee Forum
description: Hi busy bees! Welcome to today’s Spelling Bee forum. There are a number of terms that appear in both this article and other online discussions of the Spelling Bee; a glossary of those terms compiled by Monicat, a Times reader, can be found below.

title: Filmmaker’s Private Archive Rekindles Debate Over Her Nazi Ties
description: Two decades after her death, the German director Leni Riefenstahl occupies an uneasy place in film history. She directed two influential movies that are still studied for their aesthetic ambitions despite being propaganda for the Third Reich: “Triumph of the Will,” a visually striking film about the Nazi party’s 1934 rally in Nuremberg, and “Olympia,” about the 1936 Berlin Olympics.

title: Helmet Caps
description: The N.F.L. this season is allowing players to wear Guardian Caps, coverings that add a layer of foam to the outside of the helmet, with the aim of reducing brain injuries.

title: Arizona Voters Approve Abortion Rights Amendment
description: Arizona voters approved a ballot amendment enshrining a right to abortion in the State Constitution, according to The Associated Press, joining other states that have pushed back against unpopular abortion bans passed in the two years since the Supreme Court overturned Roe v. Wade.

title: South Dakota Voters Reject Abortion Rights Amendment
description: Voters in South Dakota rejected a ballot amendment that would have enshrined a right to abortion in the State Constitution, according to The Associated Press.

title: Trump Speaks as He Moves Closer to an Election Win
description: The former president addressed his supporters after he moved closer to a second term in the White House by winning some key swing states.

title: By Firing Gallant, Netanyahu Removes One Threat but Risks Another
description: By dismissing his defense minister, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel has consolidated his hold over his coalition by removing his main internal critic, making it easier for him to set wartime policy in the short term.

title: TV Networks Prepared for a Long Wait That Wasn’t
description: In the run-up to election night, and throughout the early hours of their broadcasts, television news anchors urged viewers to settle in for a long wait.

title: Barrett Flips Key Michigan Seat for G.O.P., Defeating Hertel
description: Tom Barrett, a G.O.P. former state senator, has defeated Curtis Hertel, a Democratic former state senator, according to The Associated Press, flipping an open Michigan seat and handing House Republicans a crucial victory in their drive to keep their majority.

title: Election Results Show a Red Shift Across the U.S. in 2024
description: Of the counties with nearly complete results, a vast majority shifted in favor of former President Donald J. Trump in the 2024 presidential election.

title: Trump Speaks as He Moves Closer to an Election Win
description: The former president addressed his supporters after he moved closer to a second term in the White House by winning some key swing states.

title: A New Luxury Tower Rises From a Seminary and Tries to Blend In
description: Claremont Hall, a 41-story luxury residence on the campus of Union Theological Seminary in Morningside Heights, can be easy to overlook. In a sense, it was designed to be. The neighborhood is the closest thing New York has to a Gothic Quarter; among the weathered stone and brick of the seminary, the nearby Teachers College and — directly across Claremont Avenue — the soaring Riverside Church, a showy newcomer would have stuck out like a rude guest. Claremont Hall fits in as though it’s lived there for ages, although it was only completed in June.

title: The Silly Rule That’s Helping Keep Housing Costs High
description: In too many American cities, numerous downtown office buildings sit barely used, their absence of workers gutting nearby businesses. Meanwhile, hundreds of residents, too poor to afford shelter, sleep on the streets. Addressing these problems is within our grasp.

title: A ‘Wicked’ Tearful Talk With Cynthia Erivo and Ariana Grande
description: “Excuse me,” Ariana Grande said, flagging down an imaginary waiter. “May we have one million tissues please?”

title: Her Music Makes Women ‘Feel Free’
description: While touring the Bob Marley Museum in Kingston, Jamaica, on a Saturday in late September, Shenseea, the dancehall pop singer, paused at a glass case. Inside was the Grammy lifetime achievement award that Mr. Marley received posthumously in 2001.

title: The ‘Super Bowl of Pickleball’ Looks to Grow the Sport
description: Anna Leigh Waters, a 17-year-old from Delray Beach, Fla., is the world’s top-ranked pickleball player and is widely considered to be the face of America’s fastest-growing sport. But from where she stands, she is still relatively unknown, even among a majority of the racket sport’s fans.

title: The Perfect Pecan Pie Inspired by Southern Grannies
description: Nancy Brewer, owner and baker of the Kitchen Shop in Grand Coteau, La., had a quiet epiphany in culinary school. While practicing pâte sucrée, she realized it was nearly the same dough her grandmother in Louisiana used for her sweet pies, a crumb and texture that isn’t quite a short crust and also isn’t quite a pie dough but its own thing all at once.

title: The Lip-Reading Hotshot of Celebrity Gossip
description: Not long ago, a video surfaced online that caused a stir, at least among the sizable subset of humanity that is emotionally invested in the matter of Kendall Jenner’s coiffure. The clip, recorded on Sept. 23, captured an encounter between Jenner, the model and reality star, and two fellow celebrities, the singer Camilla Cabello and the actress Eva Longoria, during the annual catwalk show for the cosmetics giant L’Oreal. The three women were in Paris, in the ornate Palais Garnier, the city’s historic opera house, engaged in an animated conversation. What exactly were they discussing? What secrets were being imparted? What dirt was being dished? Was any mention made of Bad Bunny, Jenner’s rumored on-again, off-again beau? As the poet said: Inquiring minds want to know.

title: Bridget Everett Responds to an Essay on Friendship
description: The “Somebody Somewhere” actress reflects on the power of intimacy, without romance.

title: All Hail the Theater Kid! (We Mean That Sincerely.)
description: Ariana Grande used to downplay the fact that she was a theater kid.

title: Bridget Everett Says a Best Friend Can Be Your Greatest Love
description: Stories of romantic love are everywhere, but the actor, singer and comedian Bridget Everett says great friendships deserve our time and attention, too. Not just onscreen, but in reality.

title: $490,000 Homes in Wisconsin, Utah and North Carolina
description: This four-bedroom, two-and-a-half-bath house is on a wide, tree-lined street and just steps from Lake Winnebago, a popular fishing spot where the catch includes walleye, bass and perch. Menominee Park, which has pickleball and tennis courts, a playground, a seasonal zoo and a waterfront walking trail, is a few minutes away, as is the campus of the University of Wisconsin Oshkosh. The Experimental Aircraft Association Aviation Museum is 15 minutes away, as is the E.A.A.’s Seaplane Base on Lake Winnebago.

title: She Wrote ‘Jonathan Strange & Mr. Norrell.’ Then, She Was Gone.
description: In 2004, Susanna Clarke, a cookbook editor, published her debut novel, the sprawling 800-page historical fantasy “Jonathan Strange & Mr. Norrell.” It was a sensation. Clarke sold millions of copies, won literary awards and landed on best-seller lists.

title: It’s Time to Admit America Has Changed
description: Donald Trump’s enduring hold over the Republican Party will send him back to the White House. On this episode of “The Opinions,” the columnist David French joins the deputy Opinion editor Patrick Healy to discuss the future of the G.O.P. and what a second Trump term might mean for America.

title: Trump Offered Men Something That Democrats Never Could
description: On the long road to Election Day, no group of voters was more loyal to Donald Trump than young white men. One early theory was that his success with this demographic was a result of male isolation and loneliness. But that showed a fundamental misunderstanding of Mr. Trump’s appeal. He did so well with male voters because he is a walking avatar of a kind of masculinity that Democrats could never embrace, and its appeal transcends this electoral cycle.

title: 5 Minutes That Will Make You Love the Vibraphone
description: We’re living in the era of “vibes.” But before that word was everywhere — before elections had “vibe shifts” and before a first date could be breezily ended because the vibes were just off — there was the instrument that started it all: the vibraphone.

title: Election Results in Key New York Races
description: Good morning. It’s Wednesday. Today we’ll look at how key races in New York turned out. We’ll also find out about a “vigil for the healing of the world” that the Episcopal bishop of New York will lead tonight.

title: What We Just Went Through Wasn’t an Election. It Was a Hostage Situation.
description: Heading into Tuesday’s vote, a large majority of voters said that the country was on the wrong track and that they were disappointed with the candidates on offer. A plurality of voters said that regardless of who was elected, the next president would make things worse. Nearly 80 percent said the presidential campaigns did not make them proud of America.

title: The Best Place for a Last-Minute Thanksgiving? Abroad.
description: With Thanksgiving just a few weeks away, domestic flight deals have largely evaporated. But the holiday week, when many Americans stay home or fly within the United States, is a golden window for affordable international travel, even for last-minute flights.

title: Donald Trump Declares Victory and Thanks Supporters
description: Flanked by family and supporters, Donald J. Trump declared victory in the small hours Wednesday morning from a star-spangled stage in West Palm Beach, Fla.

title: Donald Trump Returns to Power, Ushering in New Era of Uncertainty
description: Donald J. Trump rode a promise to smash the American status quo to win the presidency for a second time, surviving a criminal conviction, indictments, an assassin’s bullet, accusations of authoritarianism and an unprecedented switch of his opponent to complete a remarkable return to power.

title: Trump Wins Wisconsin, Reclaiming Battleground He Won in 2016
description: Donald J. Trump flipped Wisconsin, according to The Associated Press, taking him over the 270 electoral college votes needed to win the overall presidential race, and handing him a battleground state that he narrowly lost in 2020 to Joseph R. Biden Jr.

title: JD Vance, Trump’s MAGA Successor, Will Be One of America’s Youngest Vice Presidents
description: JD Vance, a 40-year-old senator who transformed himself from a biting critic of Donald J. Trump to one of his fiercest defenders, was elected the next vice president of the United States on Wednesday, becoming the third youngest and among the least experienced and most polarizing politicians ever to hold the office.

title: Why Trump Won
description: Opinion columnists break down how Trump won the 2024 presidential election.

title: This Is Why Trump Won
description: Donald Trump is returning to the White House, and while this will not change what most critics think of him, it should compel them to take a close look in the mirror. They lost this election as much as Mr. Trump won it.

title: It’s This Man’s, Man’s, Man’s World
description: I can no longer count the number of times I’ve counted out Donald Trump.

title: America Makes a Perilous Choice
description: American voters have made the choice to return Donald Trump to the White House, setting the nation on a precarious course that no one can fully foresee.

title: Stop Pretending Trump Is Not Who We Are
description: I remember when Donald Trump was not normal.

title: 10 Takeaways From the Night Trump Marched Back to the White House
description: Donald Trump has won the 2024 presidential election. Follow live updates here.

title: Pariah, Felon, President-Elect: How Trump Fought His Way Back to Power
description: By late January 2021, just days into Donald J. Trump’s unhappy new life as a former president, his world had shrunk to a size he could not abide.

title: America Hires a Strongman
description: Donald Trump told Americans exactly what he planned to do.

title: The Connections Companion No. 515
description: Good morning, dear connectors. Welcome to today’s Connections forum, where you can give and receive puzzle — and emotional — support.

title: Trump, Again
description: In the early hours of Wednesday morning, Donald J. Trump was elected president for a second time.

title: Trump Defeats Harris to Retake the Presidency
description: On Today’s Episode:

title: Montana Voters Approve Abortion Ballot Measure
description: Voters in Montana approved a ballot amendment that enshrines a right to abortion in the State Constitution, according to The Associated Press.

title: Four More Years of Unpredictability? The World Prepares for Trump’s Return.
description: With Donald J. Trump’s sweeping election victory on Tuesday, the world is preparing for another four years of unpredictability and “America first” protectionism that could reset the ground rules of the global economy, empower autocrats and erase American protection for democratic partners.

title: For Ukraine, Trump Victory Signals a Shift. To What, Is Unclear.
description: With Donald J. Trump’s victory in the United States presidential election, Ukrainians now face an all-but-certain American policy shift in the midst of a war that is turning against them. Russia has made some of the swiftest territorial advances in recent months, and diplomatic efforts are underway by multiple countries to find a negotiated settlement.

title: Sheehy Defeats Tester in Montana, Extending G.O.P.’s Senate Majority
description: Tim Sheehy, a wealthy Republican businessman and political novice, has defeated Senator Jon Tester of Montana, according to The Associated Press, giving the G.O.P. another seat in its new Senate majority.

title: In Trump, Netanyahu Sees a More Favorable U.S. President
description: Only a few hours had passed since Donald J. Trump was elected president, when Benjamin Netanyahu, the Prime Minister of Israel, announced that he had already spoken to the U.S. president-elect, noting he was “among the first” to call him.

title: Truth Social Stock Moves Higher on Trump Election Victory
description: Shares of Donald J. Trump’s social media company rose on Wednesday after the former president clinched another term in office but not nearly as much as many shareholders might have hoped.

title: President Trump, Again
description: Donald Trump has completed a stunning political comeback, and the United States has entered an uncertain new era.

title: ‘Pedro Páramo’ Review: A Ghost Story Lacking in Spirit
description: The Mexican writer Juan Rulfo’s mystifying 1955 novel “Pedro Páramo” is, at least in the English-speaking world, most often invoked for its influence on Gabriel García Márquez. But admirers of the book (Susan Sontag famously among them) have long cited it as a masterpiece of spare surrealism.

title: ‘Meet Me Next Christmas’ Review: An a Cappella Affair to Remember
description: You’d be forgiven if you were convinced in the early goings of “Meet Me Next Christmas” that the Netflix film is just a slightly more expensive Hallmark Christmas movie combined with a wild-goose chase rom-com.

title: Lawler Wins New York Swing Seat, Lifting Republican House Chances
description: Representative Mike Lawler, one of the nation’s most endangered Republican incumbents, won a second term, according to The Associated Press, holding onto a suburban New York district that is typically tilted toward Democrats.

title: I Quit the First Trump Administration. Principled People Must Serve in the Second.
description: In 2018, as a member of the first Trump administration, I anonymously published an opinion essay in The Times warning that President Donald Trump was unstable and a danger to “the health of our Republic.”

title: How Trump Won, Again
description: When Donald J. Trump won the presidency eight years ago, it was easy to cast his victory as a narrow one — or even dismiss it as a fluke.

title: The Winners and Losers of Trump 2.0
description: In the end, it wasn’t all that close. Donald Trump has reclaimed the presidency, besting Vice President Kamala Harris in what has been one of the most expensive elections in U.S. history.

title: Control of the House Remains Up for Grabs
description: By Wednesday morning, it was clear that Republicans had retaken the White House and the Senate. But it will take longer to know if they can maintain control of the House of Representatives, where dozens of races are still too close to call.

title: Donald Trump Makes Stunning Return to Power
description: During this presidential campaign, Donald Trump played on economic worries and fears around immigration to defeat Vice President Kamala Harris. Shane Goldmacher, a national political correspondent for The New York Times, explains.

title: A Party of Prigs and Pontificators Suffers a Humiliating Defeat
description: A story in chess lore involves the great Danish Jewish player Aron Nimzowitsch, who, at a tournament in the mid-1920s, found himself struggling against the German master Friedrich Sämisch. Infuriated at the thought of losing to an opponent he considered inferior, Nimzowitsch jumped on the table and shouted, “To this idiot I must lose?”

title: Morning TV Hosts Digest Trump Victory
description: The tone was triumphant early Wednesday morning on “Fox and Friends,” in the hours after the Fox News network called the presidential race for Donald J. Trump.

title: Trump Is Not the First President to Come Back From Defeat
description: Declared the winner of the 2024 presidential election, Donald J. Trump is on track for a host of firsts: He is forecast to be the first Republican to win the national popular vote in two decades, and is the first person with a criminal record to win the presidency. Earlier this year, he became the first former president to be convicted of a felony.

title: Our Daughter Is Having an Affair With a Married Man. How Do We Stop It?
description: Our daughter (early 20s) is having an affair with her former boss at a fast-food restaurant. He is married, and his wife discovered the affair by seeing texts on her husband’s phone. We discovered it by noticing a big increase in data usage on our phone bill. (They text each other incessantly!) We asked our daughter to stop working at the restaurant, and we believed that the affair had ended and that husband and wife were trying to work things out. Recently, though, I became suspicious and saw on our daughter’s phone that the affair was ongoing. We told her we were disappointed in her, but she refuses to end things. She lives at home and drives our car, and we are fuming. We are tempted to tell this man’s wife about the affair, but we don’t want to crash our daughter’s life worse than she’s doing herself. Thoughts?

title: Democrats Got the Recovery They Wanted. It Wasn’t Enough.
description: Every major U.S. ally is uncomfortably familiar with one of President Biden’s favorite charts. It is a graph of economic recoveries in the wealthy world since the end of the pandemic recession. It shows growth flatlining for the United Kingdom, Germany and Japan over the past two years — while in the United States, growth keeps rocketing up.

title: Corrections: Nov. 6, 2024
description: A Times Insider article on Friday about efforts to make election news accessible for Spanish speakers misspelled the surname of a reporter. She is Jennifer Medina, not Molina.

title: With Political Victory, Trump Fights Off Legal Charges
